intro: Compsoa flava, commonly known as the yellow crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant produces small, elongated pods that contain several seeds. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in open woodlands or disturbed soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain areas.
